intro: Arthrostemma angusturense, commonly known as the narrow-leaved arrowroot, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale purple or white, arranged in whorls along the stem. Its rhizomatous root system is notable for its starchy, edible tubers, which are used in traditional cuisines. Arthrostemma angusturense thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
